mdlib.pre package¶

Submodules¶

mdlib.pre.build module¶

Create a LAMMPS input data file from another

This script return a LAMMPS input data file for running crystalline simulations Allows the user to replicate a unit cell similar to the replicate command in LAMMPS. The script also generates the map file required by fix-phonon The user specifies an LAMMPS data file which serves as the unit cell. The unit cell is repeated in the X,Y,Z directions.

mdlib.pre.build.lmpbox(oldbox: numpy.array)¶

Makes a non-LAMMPS box into LAMMPS compatible

Boxes or unit vectors in LAMMPS have to obey certain rules. See section on triclinic boxes The function rotates a 3x3 numpy array so that it is LAMMPS compliant following the method given on the website.

:type oldbox : numpy.array :param oldbox: 3x3 array with basis vectors as the columns :return: the new box rotated to comply with lammps :rtype: numpy.array

mdlib.pre.build.replicate(xsys: mdlib.Csystem.Csystem, nrep: list) → tuple¶

Replicates a crystalline system to create an array of atoms and a box

Parameters

  • xsys (:py:class:Csystem) – crystalline system containing basis vectors and atoms

  • nrep (list) – 3 integers representing repetition in the x,y,z directions

Returns

the atoms, the map information, the cell or box, and the origin

mdlib.pre.build.write_from_file(fin, nx, ny, nz, foutn) → None¶

Builds a crystal from input, replicating as necessary, and outputs the result to a file :param fin: input file name :type fin: str :param nx: number of unit cells in x-direction :type nx: int :param ny: number of unit cells in y-direction :type ny: int :param nz: number of unit cells in z-direction :type nz: int :param fout: LAMMPS output file name :type fout: str

Note

function always outputs a triclinic lammps box

Note

function does not check if the input lammps file has a valied box

Module contents¶

Pre-processing sub-module for creating the LAMMPS input file and map file for fix-phonon. Can be imported as a package or used as a script
